pkgmetadata.longdescription: Bayesian Survival Models for High-Dimensional Data // An implementation of Bayesian survival models with graph- structured selection priors for sparse identification of omics features predictive of survival (Madjar et al., 2021 doi:10.1186/s12859-021-04483-z) and its extension to use a fixed graph via a Markov Random Field (MRF) prior for capturing known structure of omics features, e.g. disease-specific pathways from the Kyoto Encyclopedia of Genes and Genomes database.
